title: New Reports on Russian Interference Show Trump’s Claims on Obama Are Overblown
summary: The administration’s claims are overblown, but newly declassified information provides some messy details about a January 2017 intelligence assessment of Moscow’s election interference.

title: Trump Administration to Release $5.5 Billion in Frozen Schools Funding
summary: The Trump administration had faced growing pressure from within his own party to release the money.

title: Behind Trump’s War With Powell: A Battering Ram With 3 Million Followers
summary: The director of the Federal Housing Finance Agency has made the removal of the Fed chair his personal mission.

title: After Ghislaine Maxwell Interview, Concerns Mount Over Possibility of a Trump Pardon
summary: President Trump, asked whether he would consider pardoning her, said, “I’m allowed to do it, but it’s something I haven’t thought about.”

title: As Consumers Lose Their Appetite, Food Brands Fight to Keep Wall St. Happy
summary: Packaged food companies are struggling to adjust — and profit — as tastes, waistlines and wallets change.

title: The First ‘Fantastic Four’: The Superhero Movie That Never Was
summary: The first attempt at making a film about the superheroes was an extremely low-budget affair that was shot, abandoned and mostly forgotten about in the 1990s.

title: States Look to Europe to Improve U.S. Prison Conditions
summary: States of all political stripes, including Oklahoma, North Dakota and Massachusetts, have sent officials to tour prisons in Germany in search of ways to improve conditions for American inmates.

title: Under Siege From Trump and Musk, a Top Liberal Group Falls Into Crisis
summary: Scrambling to pay legal fees, Media Matters has dialed back its criticism, trimmed its staff and contemplated closing entirely.

title: Macron Recognizes a Palestinian State. But to What End?
summary: The French president, expressing a moral obligation to address suffering in Gaza, made clear he had lost patience with the United States and Israel. The question is what effect he will have.

title: He Placated Regulators to Buy Paramount. But Can He Fix the Business?
summary: Paramount’s cable business has cratered. The news division is in turmoil. A.I. is coming for movies. And those are just the obvious challenges facing David Ellison as he takes control.

title: Two Democratic Governors Say if Texas Redraws Congressional Maps, They May Too
summary: After meetings with Democrats from the Texas House, Gavin Newsom and JB Pritzker suggested their states could counter a gerrymander by Texas Republicans.

title: The Manmade Clouds That Could Help Save the Great Barrier Reef
summary: Inside a bold — and controversial — effort to cool the water around this beloved ecosystem.

title: The Gen Z New Yorkers Selling Their Parents on Mamdani
summary: Young voters went for Zohran Mamdani by a large margin. Can they persuade their parents to do the same?

title: Election Officials Allege Possible Voter Fraud in Republican Primary
summary: The New York City Board of Elections asked prosecutors to investigate potential ballot stuffing in a City Council race in southern Brooklyn.

title: The Line Trump Crossed by Accusing Obama of Treason
summary: President Trump’s history of intemperate remarks has earned him a perverse kind of immunity; the more outrageous his statement, the faster it is often dismissed.

title: Is Decarbonization Dead?
summary: Trump just shredded America’s most ambitious climate policy. Jane Flegal and Jesse Jenkins discuss what this means for the future of renewable energy in the U.S.

title: Taiwan Votes in Recall Campaign That Tests China’s Nerves
summary: An unprecedented recall vote could hand President Lai Ching-te more power by ousting legislative opponents. It could also prompt a response from China.

title: Outrage After Alabama 3-Year-Old Dies in Hot Car While in State’s Care
summary: The boy, who was in foster care, was being transported between a supervised visit and day care, his aunt said. State lawmakers said they were seeking answers and the police were investigating.

title: Why Zelensky Backtracked on His Controversial Law
summary: Facing growing pressure amid nationwide protests, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine backtracked on controversial legislation that would have weakened the country’s independent anticorruption institutions. Katrin Bennhold, a senior writer, and Marc Santora, an international news editor for The New York Times, explain the events that led to the reversal.

title: 2 Crew Members Are Hurt as Southwest Plane Plunges Abruptly After Takeoff
summary: The sudden maneuver was made during a Friday flight out of California after two collision safety alerts sounded in the cockpit, causing the pilots to take evasive action, the airline said.

title: U.S. Conducts Rare Raid in Syria, Killing a Senior Islamic State Leader
summary: The military gave few details on the ground operation, but counterterrorism raids have typically involved helicopter-borne Special Operations commandos.
